column3: For what it's worth, this was tried before in 2014 and rejected: #5242
I think a standardized version of the word would be better than having two different writing styles.
I think both are acceptable and intelligible. I don't think standardization for standardization's sake is worthwhile, so I'm a weak NACK on this.
Hahaha you took up a great issue though, more of a non-technical thing in this technical hub.

I agree with @jnewbery.

Generally for spelling we accept British English or American English or mixed dialects, as long as it is understandable.
I do have a slight preference for blockchain, but then I am the wrong person to ask, because I wrongly assumed it was `timezone` as opposed to `time zone` just today.
Sorry, going to close this. This turned out to be too controversial.
